contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox_TV_channel | name = Xing Kong | logo= XingKonglogo.gif | launch = 1 January 2002 | owner = [[STAR (Greater China)|STAR TV]]<br>[[Fox International Channels]] | country = [[Hong Kong]] | web = [http://www.xingkong.com.cn/ Official Site] | sat serv 1 = [[AsiaSat]] 3S [[China]] | sat chan 1 = 4000MHz Horizontal, Transponder 10H ([[C-Band]]) <ref>[http://lyngsat.com/asia3s.html AsiaSat 3S at 105.5Â°E - LyngSat]</ref> | sat serv 2 = [[Cignal Digital TV]] [[Philippines]] | sat chan 2 = Channel TBA | cable serv 1 = [[CBTV]] [[China]] | cable chan 1 = Channel 508 | cable serv 2 = [[StarHub TV]] [[Singapore]] | cable chan 2 = Channel 821 | cable serv 3 = [[Vietbao CATV]] [[Vietnam]] | cable chan 3 = Channel 85 | cable serv 4 = [[First Media]] [[Indonesia]] | cable chan 4 = Channel 206 | cable serv 5 = [[Skywave TV]] [[Macau]] | cable chan 5 = Channel 15 | cable serv 6 = [[TelkomVision]] [[Indonesia]] | cable chan 6 = Channel ??? | cable serv 7 = [[Cable Star Iloilo]] [[Philippines]] | cable chan 7 = Channel 59 | cable serv 8 = [[MyCATV Lucena]] [[Philippines]] | cable chan 8 = Channel 61 | cable serv 9 = [[SkyCable]] [[Philippines]] | cable chan 9 = Channel TBA | cable serv 10 = [[Destiny Cable]] [[Philippines]] | cable chan 10 = Channel TBA | iptv serv 1 = [[now TV]] [[Hong Kong]] | iptv chan 1 = Channel 540 | iptv serv 2 = [[Mio TV]] [[Singapore]] | iptv chan 2 = Channel 516 }} '''Xing Kong''' is a [[Mandarin language]] TV channel owned by [[STAR (Greater China)|STAR TV]] and [[Fox International Channels]] in partnership with China Media Capital, also known as '''STAR Chinese Channel China''', It was voted "Satellite Channel of the Year" at the 2002 China Television Programme Awards. The channel is packed with more than 700 hours of original programming each year, with content that includes drama series, comedies, variety, talk and game shows. This channel was similar to other mandarin entertainment channels like [[STAR Chinese Channel]] in Taiwan and [[Phoenix Television|Phoenix Chinese Channel]] a 50/50 joint venture with STAR TV/Fox International Channels and [[Phoenix Television]]. Xing Kong is currently available in [[Mainland China]], [[Hong Kong]], [[Macau]], [[Singapore]], [[Indonesia]], [[Vietnam]] and the [[Philippines]]. Xing Kong is available as free-to-view on AsiaSat 3S over the Asia-Pacific region (given that the local laws permit the use of privately owned satellite dishes). ==Operating channels== * Xing Kong International Channel (for countries and territories outside Mainland China) * Xing Kong Regional Channel ''(for Mainland China only)'' ==Availability== ===Mainland China=== * Xing Kong is available on CBTV Satellite TV. ===Macau=== * Xing Kong is exclusively available on Skywave Satellite TV. ===Hong Kong=== * Xing Kong is exclusively available on [[now TV]], started late 2004, channel 540. ===Singapore=== * Xing Kong is available on [[StarHub TV]], part of the Chinese Infotainment Basic Upsize Group on Channel 821. * Xing Kong is availabie on [[Mio TV]] part of the Jingxuan Plus on Channel 516 ===Indonesia=== * Xing Kong is available on [[:id:First Media|First Media]] (formerly Kabelvision) and Telkomvision. ===Philippines=== * Xing Kong is available on selected provincial cable companies. ===Vietnam=== * Xing Kong is available on Hanoi Cable Television (BTS) was launched last October 29, 2007 Channel 85. ===Asia-Pacific Region=== * Xing Kong is broadcast free-to-air on AsiaSat 3S over the Asia-Pacific region (given that the local laws permit the use of privately owned Satellite dishes). This coverage spans from [[Outer Mongolia]] all the way to [[Australia]] and [[New Zealand]]. Although the [[geostationary]] satellite is located directly above China, private satellite tuning is prohibited in the mainland. ==Citations== {{reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.xingkong.com.cn/ Xing Kong Mainland China Official Site] {{zh icon}} * [http://60.28.210.155/ Xing Kong International Site] {{zh icon}} {{tv-station-stub}} {{21st Century Fox}} {{STAR}} {{Fox Entertainment Group}} {{Chinese language television in North America}} {{Television in the People's Republic of China}} {{Television in Hong Kong}} {{Chinese language television in Southeast Asia}} {{Television in the Republic of China}} [[Category:Chinese television networks]] [[Category:Cable television in Hong Kong]] [[Category:Television channels and stations established in 2002]] [[Category:2002 establishments in Hong Kong]]
